isis.stitle: POWER STEERING PUMP: EATON MODEL BB135 R, L - ASSEMBLE

note.para: Before reassembly all parts must be thoroughly cleaned.

step1.para: Assemble a new shaft oil seal (steel cage side out) into the pump body bushing sub-assembly ( Figure 16). Use a socket or steel tubing approximately the size of the seal O.D. to press the oil seal to the bottom of the bore ( Figure 17). Use caution not to cave in the oil seal's case due to excessive assembly pressure. The seal must bottom in the bore, however. Direct drive pumps may have two seals. The second seal will be installed with the steel cage side in.

If the ball bearing is replaced on pulley driven pumps, press shaft from old bearing and replace by pressing new bearing onto shaft, supporting the press load on the inner race only. Permanent damage and early failure will result if the outer race is loaded during pressing operation.

Prior to inserting the shaft sub-assembly for pulley driven pumps into the pump, lubricate the oil seal and bushing with a generous amount of light grease. Do not use petroleum jelly. Ensure that the shaft areas to be pushed through seal lips are free of burrs or sharp edges. ( Figure 18). Insert the shaft into position in the pump body, using caution not to damage shaft seal lip. Assemble bearing retainer snap ring ( Figure 19).

note.para: The shaft for gear driven pumps is installed from the carrier side after the carrier and rolls have been re-installed.

step1.para: If end plate seals are to be replaced, assemble O-ring seal into the bottom of each kidney-shaped seal gland ( Figure 11). Assemble square cross-section seal into each gland and stack on top of the O-ring. All seals should fit tightly to gland wall.

Determine correct end plate and locating pin position as noted at the time of disassembly, or see Figure 20, and assemble end plate into body ( Figure 21). Assemble port plate ( Figure 22) in the same position as noted at disassembly or such that the entire seal is covered by the port plate, and that the large O.D. port openings on port plate and end plate align.

figure.caption: Figure 20. Correct End Plate and Locating Pin Position

step1.para: Carefully assemble the cam ring ( Figure 23) into the pump body pocket and position it over the locating pin. Be sure to assemble the cam ring in the original manner, noting the arrow direction. Again, the large O.D. slot must align with large O.D. port openings on port plate.
At this point, lubricate the face of the port plate, the shaft bushing, and the I.D. wall of the cam ring with a small amount of clean power steering fluid.
Assemble carrier drive pin into shaft keyway and assemble carrier in proper direction ( Figure 24).
For gear driven pumps, install shaft and key into carrier and pump housing from the carrier side.

caution.para: Prior to inserting the shaft sub-assembly into the pump, lubricate the shaft seal and bushing with a generous amount of compatible grease and insert the shaft into position using caution not to damage the shaft seal lip. A seal protector or "BULLIT" fitted to the shaft end is recommended to avoid seal damage.

step1.para: Insert the 10 rolls into the carrier and lubricate the carrier face and shaft with a small amount of the clean oil to be used in the steering system.
Assemble two seals to body face grooves, at the cam pocket-and-flow by-pass hole ( Figure 8).
Lubricate cover wear face ( Figure 25) and bushing with clean steering fluid and assemble to pump body, over the shaft and dowel pin ( Figure 26).

Lubricate the valve bore with a small amount of oil. Insert the valve assembly into the bore with the long small diameter end in first ( Figure 27). The valve must slide smoothly in the bore. Lubricate and assemble the new seal to the valve cap. Assemble the flow control spring into the valve bore and thread the valve cap in finger tight ( Figure 28).

figure.caption: Figure 28. Control Spring and Cap Installation

step1.para: Assemble the five 3/8-16 body to cover retaining bolts and install bracket in proper position.

Assemble the flange (and bearing assembly) for gear driven pumps, noting the proper index positions to the front of the pump using 3/8-16 bolts finger tight, and also installing new flange O-rings or face gaskets if required being careful not to pinch or damage the O-ring. Tighten the 3/8-16 body to cover bolts to 35 ft-lbs. (47.5 Nm).
Clamp the pump mounting bracket or flange in a bench vise in such a manner as to complete the assembly of the pump and reservoir.
Tighten the valve cap to 40 ft-lbs. (54.0 Nm).

The base pump is now assembled. Check the shaft to determine if it rotates freely and smoothly. Maximum shaft turning torque is 10 in-lbs. (1.13 Nm). If torque is excessive, disassemble pump and check for pinched O-rings, burrs or contamination. Relube and reassemble.
